newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Ansett confirms talks on international tie-ups.
newsitem.headline: Ansett confirms talks on international tie-ups.

text.p: Ansett Australia said on Wednesday it and major shareholder Air New Zealand Ltd were talking to Singapore Airlines and United Airlines about forming international partnerships.

"We are talking to Singapore Airlines, but we are talking to a lot of other people as well. Clearly they have to be joint Ansett-Air New Zealand discussions. We are not going to act unilaterally on this," Ansett executive chairman Rod Eddington told the aviation press club. Ansett is equally owned by Air New Zealand and the News Corp Ltd.
Eddington described Ansett's partnership with Air New Zealand as "the bedrock alliance" but said other tie-ups were needed to deliver economies of scale.
"Air New Zealand already has a formal alliance with United," he said, adding that Ansett also wanted to take its relationship with United to a formal alliance.
"But that still leaves a large chunk of the globe unattended," Eddington said.
